meanings.sent1: The grovellers begged for forgiveness from their boss.
meanings.sent2: The king was surrounded by grovellers seeking his favor.
meanings.sent3: The group of grovellers comically tripped over each other in their rush to please.
meanings.sent4: The grovellers in the court resembled a flock of sheep following the shepherd.
meanings.sent5: The image of the grovellers bowing low before the queen was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To behave in a servile or obsequious manner.
meanings.sent1: She grovellers before those in power to gain their approval.
meanings.sent2: He grovellers to his superiors in hopes of promotion.
meanings.sent3: The waiter grovellers excessively, making the customers uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The politician grovellers to the lobbyists, seeking their support.
meanings.sent5: The employee's constant grovelling annoyed his colleagues.
